title: Ticket #4645: Stats publication should be configurable using a whitelist
description:
Currently, the publication of statistics is controlled by configuring a verbosity level for the publication of each set of statistics. The stats themselves have a verbosity level set by the programmer, the user can choose what verbosity level to publish by setting the STATISTICS_TO_PUBLISH configuration variable. If verbosity 2 is chosen for SCHEDD stats, then all stats of verbosity 2 or lower will be published. This is a huge amount and will flood the collector, so in practice only verbosity 0 or 1 is useful.

But some of the stats that we wish to track are set at verbosity 2. So a way is needed to specify a list of stats that should always be published, regardless of the current publication verbosity.

A new configuration variable STATISTICS_TO_PUBLISH_LIST will contain a comma or space separated list of classad attributes, each statistic that matches at least one entry in that list will be have it's verbosity set to the current STATISTICS_TO_PUBLISH verbosity level. Thus these will always publish. Because some stats are published in sets (i.e. a count,total,min,max,avg & std). Enabling one member of the set will enable all of them.
